page.title: 20NATURE TRAIL AT IBSTOCK
page.content: The building of a nature trail in Ibstock over the last few years has pleased many villagers. It was the idea of Mr Vic Price and Mr Alan Fairbrother who felt that an overgrown spinney between Pretoria Road and Spring Road could be put to better use. Another reason was that the nearby cemetery between the two roads was often used as a short cut, occasional vandalism resulting. The nature trail link, built at a cost of Â£2,500, has eliminated much of this vandalism. Features of the nature trail are the 120-year-old beech trees, which normally grow on chalk soil but are thriving on the Ibstock clay, and a pond onto which it is hoped to introduce some bird life.
